intro: Echinospermum greenei, commonly known as the Greene's echinospermum, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of the southwestern United States. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which is characterized by its composite flower heads and diverse morphological features. The plant typically features hairy stems and produces small, daisy-like flowers with yellow disc florets and white ray florets. Its leaves are usually narrow and covered in fine pubescence, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Echinospermum greenei is adapted to arid environments, showcasing resilience through its structural and physiological traits.
